34ba623bfae6de5e50167abd85cc279b (02:14): StR: use an interface until you start to see common behavior between implementations of that interface.
54e60fcf9f1cc742583d1cc255de2d3a (02:14): Ignore the typo in the mail function

54e60fcf9f1cc742583d1cc255de2d3a (02:14): In my real one it has a closing quote :P
34ba623bfae6de5e50167abd85cc279b (02:14): StR: at that point, make it an abstract class and put the common behavior in there.
34ba623bfae6de5e50167abd85cc279b (02:14): In a nutshell..

df1d625edea2dde3690debc20e6d9c93 (02:22): Hi! I think I once came by a pearl script that allowed you to store the vhosts in php.ini in a MySQL database or something like that.
9678ea1fdb7da6e5fb5aaefe48cec115 (02:22): runing phpmyadmin c_k?
df1d625edea2dde3690debc20e6d9c93 (02:22): Is that even possible or do I just have a bad memory?
34ba623bfae6de5e50167abd85cc279b (02:23): johey, everybody should use english.  Then we wouldn't have to worry about this unicode crap :-)
1c7873b9dd5623c014441dfd96fc0880 (02:23): c_k: grant (insert permissions here) on (insert db here) to (insert user here)@(insert ipaddress here)
54e60fcf9f1cc742583d1cc255de2d3a (02:23): shall i use an elseif capt'n ?
0edb38153cf8f78db80245fe3e61e00f (02:23): c_k: most mysql servers are setup so that only ppl connecting with localhost/ will have access
df1d625edea2dde3690debc20e6d9c93 (02:23): If so, does anybody have the script or does anybody know another solution?
9678ea1fdb7da6e5fb5aaefe48cec115 (02:23): lclark: OMFG you are so right
0edb38153cf8f78db80245fe3e61e00f (02:23): this prevents password attacks.
56ab2340b7ee17e2ac8486ddb4464c87 (02:23): yeah true just trying to find out how to get around that now to allow it from one address

56ab2340b7ee17e2ac8486ddb4464c87 (02:23): ie the address of the webserver

1c7873b9dd5623c014441dfd96fc0880 (02:24): use [ instead of (
34ba623bfae6de5e50167abd85cc279b (02:24): c_k, permissions are usually in the username@hostname format.
